poem:
Title: "Digital Battlefront"

In this new theatre of war,
Bits and bytes replace bullet and blade.
Breached, they say, soldier's pay at stake,
Whispers across silicon, unseen foes awake.
Man's invention, his greatest dread,
His own progress, a silenced threat.
Oh, the irony of machine and mortar,
A desk-bound hacker replacing the border.
